title: Vietnam: people and war (D)
subject_group: Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/War victims
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Guerrilla warfare
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/War and society
Armed Forces, Military, War & Weapons/Vietnam War, 1961-1975
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Vietnam - Politics and government
description: A report on the war in Vietnam (1966). Superimposed on internal rivalry and political tension, it involves not only the people who fight it but also the people who cannot escape it. Scenes of the guerilla type warfare, the ramsacking of villages and rebel street fighting, resulting in the needless suffering of the aged, women and children set the pattern of a brutal war. Reporter: Michael Charlton. NB: CONTAINS SOME DISTURBING IMAGES.
